main event: A civilian in Troy, Ohio observed a very bright, sharply outlined object in the sky for about 45 minutes on June 24, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared to be white and reddish in color, and it suddenly disappeared in a flash of white and red light.
The object moved behind and in front of clouds at times during the observation.
The witness compared the size of the object to the size of the moon.
The witness estimated the object was moving at a speed faster than the fastest jet aircraft.
The witness reported that another person was with them and also saw the object.
sighted object: a very bright, sharply outlined object
witnesses: a civilian and another unspecified witness
photographs: no photographs present in the report
